query.comment: • A - for all paths ( “A” in UPPAAL). A[] p – p holds invariantly. • p is true in all reachable states.
A<> p – p will inevitable become true, the automaton is guaranteed to eventually reach a state in which p is true. p is true in some state of all paths
• F - some state in a path ( “<>” in UPPAAL).
• G - all states in a path ( “[]” in UPPAAL).
• E<> p – it is possible to reach a state in which p is satisfied • p is true in (at least) one reachable state.
E - exists a path ( “E” in UPPAAL). E[] p – p is potentially always true. • There exists a path in which p is true in all states.
p --> q – if p becomes true, q will inevitably become true. same as A[]( p imply A<> q ) • In all paths, if p becomes true, q will inevitably become true.
